Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent to which Sen. Obama has never taken on his party leaders on a single major issue.
Understate: The claim may understate the examples provided by the expert where Sen. Obama did cross up his party.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that Sen. Obama has never taken on his party leaders on a single major issue.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that taking on party leaders on a single major issue is the only measure of independence or willingness to challenge one's own party.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for Sen. Obama's voting record that are not considered in the claim.
